conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a projectile moving freely between two parallel rails, with current flowing through the rails and the projectile, generating a magnetic field and propelling the projectile via Lorentz force.
Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model with a rail length of 0.5 m, rail spacing of 0.02 m, projectile mass of 0.02 kg, rail current of 10 A, and magnetic field strength of 1 T.
All resistances are neglected in the problem.

premise: The Lorentz force on the projectile is given by F = B I d.
conclusion: The Lorentz force on the projectile is F = 0.2 N.

premise: The work done by the Lorentz force to launch the projectile is W = F * L.
conclusion: The work done by the Lorentz force is W = 0.1 J.

premise: The work done is equal to the change in kinetic energy of the projectile, W = 0.1 J = 0.5 * m * v^2.
conclusion: The velocity of the projectile is v = sqrt(10) m/s.

premise: The time taken to launch the projectile can be found using v = L / t.
conclusion: The time taken to launch the projectile is t ≈ 0.158 s.

premise: Power is defined as the work done per unit time, P = W / t.
conclusion: The power calculated using work done per unit time is P ≈ 0.633 W.

premise: The voltage can be found using V = B I d.
conclusion: The voltage across the rails is V = 0.2 V.

premise: Power is also the product of voltage and current, P = V I.
conclusion: The power calculated using voltage and current is P = 2 W.
